meanings.definition: To blow or come in light gusts.
meanings.sent1: The wind was whiffing through the trees gently.
meanings.sent2: I could feel the cool breeze whiffing against my face.
meanings.sent3: The playful wind was whiffing around like a mischievous child.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood whiffed through my mind like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The scent of fresh flowers whiffing in the air was delightful.

meanings.definition: To inhale a short, quick breath.
meanings.sent1: She was whiffing in anticipation of blowing out the birthday candles.
meanings.sent2: After running, he was whiffing heavily to catch his breath.
meanings.sent3: The puppy kept whiffing in excitement at the sight of its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The news of the surprise party made her heart whiff with joy.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies had everyone whiffing in delight.

meanings.sent1: The batter was whiffing at every pitch, unable to make contact.
meanings.sent2: The pitcher managed to strike out the batter by whiffing him with a curveball.
meanings.sent3: The player felt embarrassed after whiffing three times in a row.
meanings.sent4: The final whiffing strike echoed through the stadium, sealing the victory.
meanings.sent5: The crowd groaned as the player whiffed at the crucial moment.
